Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of VTE Prophylaxis in Korean Patients Undergoing Gastrectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised controlled trial was conducted at Seoul St Mary’s Hospital, South Korea, from August 1, 2011, to March 31, 2015

Participants.evidence: Patients with histologically confirmed gastric adenocarcinoma were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either intermittent pneumatic compression (IPC) alone or IPC plus low-molecular-weight (LMW) heparin sodium

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was VTE incidence within the postoperative period

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 682 patients were randomised, with 341 in each group

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis included 666 patients, using both intention-to-treat and per-protocol approaches

Result_Outcome.evidence: VTE incidence was 3.6% in the IPC-only group and 0.6% in the IPC+LMW heparin group (P = .008)

Harms.evidence: Bleeding complications occurred in 9.1% of the IPC+LMW heparin group and 1.2% of the IPC-only group (P < .001)
